review: I bought one of these initially for a small bedroom tv, and ended up liking it enough to buy them for the other tv's in the house. There's not as many apps out there as I'd like, but more are supposed to be on the way. Also, when doing initial setup from my Chromebook laptop, it refused to connect to my wifi. I switched over to my tablet Chromecast app, and was up and running in 3 minutes. I can pull up Netflix and Youtube on other devices, but I like the simplicity of Chromecast.

review: After reading numerous reviews- thank u amazon reviewers! It was really helpful! However, I of course still ran into some issues and it wasn't quite as easy to install like I thought. However, I have been using it lately and love it on my big screen tv and still utilizing the ipad. I only wish there were more apps to support it. It is limited in what I am able to use it for. I have been using it on net flicks and at times it freezes so I am unable to fast forward like I love to do! But overall love the concept and for a third of the price of a roku or Apple TV...and so small... It's still worth it.

review: for the price you can't go wrong, some very nice features, even though my google tv and/or xbox already do most of them, but i also can't take those with me whenever i go, i mean not that i haven't tried, but people give me odd looks when they see me carrying a 60" tv around, i mean it won't be long until our phones are that big, we'll see who will be looking weird then. perhaps its biggest most useful feature is also its weakest one - the chrome tab streaming, this has huge potential but it's very laggy, they need to work more on this, hopefully it will be out of beta in the near future as that is going to be the real kicker and differentiator, they also need to get it working on the android chrome, and while at it make android screen mirroring, then this device will be golden, man, i should work for google, or something.

review: This little device works absolutely great for watching things in 10 minute increments. After that, do not bother. If you're using it strictly for sharing short clips on YouTube, then it's perfect. But for anything longer than 10 minutes, expect pauses, drops, resets, and a viewing experience far longer than you actually anticipate.I found no documentation on how to get past the ten minute blues, just suggesting resets for my router. Resets done, chromecast still being persnickety. This has the potential to be a great device. It's just not there yet. I really hope Google straigtens this out, because honestly I would love to see it work better.Apps used: Netflix, HBO Go, YouTube, and casting straight from a tab.
